rawLines.text: Hey, it's Arvid and this is the
bootstrap founder.
[Music]
Today I'm talking to Amomar Goch, the
founder of Senmate. That's a SAS
platform that's been helping Maid
service owners grow their businesses
since 2013.
Amomar is one of those amazing founders
who really embodies the bootstrapping
spirit because when his co-founder left
early on just around 15k of MR, he could
have easily given up. But instead, he
stuck with it and relentlessly focused
on customers and persisted. He had built
Senmate into 150K per month business
over the past 12 years. And what makes
Amar's story particularly inspiring is
that he's a nontechnical founder who
used this customer development approach
from day one. And he really listened to
his market and built exactly what made
service owners needed. He also created
this incredible content marketing

conference podcast all that kind of

just selling his software. So, it's very
inspirational and there's a couple of
really, really interesting insights in
here. We're talking about the power of
persistence and bootstrapping, how to
build as a non-technical founder, how
important customer development really
is, and how you can create content that
truly serves the community that you're
serving. We'll also dive into building
this remote first location independent
company and stay focused on your
customer success over quick growth. Like
I said, 12 years, right? That's a long

of record payment provider of choice.
They're taking care of all the things

only we can build. Paddle handles all

12 years now, just over 12 years. And I

tenacity and the resilience to stick

want you to take me back to your 2013
when it all started. Did you know back

So, I think anyone that says yes to this
like question that's a successful
entrepreneur is lying unless it's like
their second or third business. Um, no.

opportunity
both in the actual industry where we've
